name: Lisa
info: A Sinner who is adept at disturbing enemies. Uses [Consonance] to reduce enemies' Movement Speed by 10% for 4 seconds.
criminalRecord:
The only suspect behind a new-rising Eastside artist to fall off a building, and after the incident, deliberately covered and distorted the truth and stirred up outrage. The subject has had a bad record of stirring up many internet debates, which is harmful to the healthy development of the DisCity internet.

--

After repeated examination of the footage of the fall, it's found that the subject didn't use her power at the scene in an attempt to murder but to stop the artist from committing suicide. Unfortunately she failed to prevent the tragedy.

As an art critic, the subject is highly acclaimed in the industry. Her critiques serve to push Eastside's art circle forward, therefore she's been permitted internet use in detention so that she can continue to pursue her career.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
The subject's special power can create a semi-solid phantom substance, which attacks the enemy in the butterfly phantom form and effectively interfere with the target's mind.

+++* Awakening Signs
The subject claims to have attempted to save the young artist from jumping off the building, but got trapped in a flashback hallucination and awakened after the mental shock.

+++* Corruption State
The subject's occasional nightmare and quirky personality has been proved to have nothing to do with mutation. It is speculated that it to be caused by psychological trauma from the past. No obvious symptoms of erosion were found.
ecbFlavourText:
"Don't give up on yourself just because of some little obstacles... you bastard."
"I didn't choose death even after what I went through..."
arrestRec1: According to the video recording of the suicide scene of the young artist, the suspect involved was suspected of having special powers. After secretly confirming the identity as a Sinner, the subject was arrested in a low-key way due to the subject's public profile. The subject protested during the arrest but without violent means.
arrestRec2: The subject's parents are ordinary Eastside residents with no art-related work experience but fully support the subject's artistic career. They currently live in an Eastside apartment Lisa bought, and are unaware of their daughter's poor public image and arrest.
arrestRec3: Became famous is Eastside with the painting "Butterfly". Being unable to paint after the car crash, the subject entered the field of art critics. Her provocative comments have attracted much attention and led to a polarization in her public image.
arrestRec4: The MBCC found a large number of dusty paintings in the basement of her house by young painters criticized by Lisa. According to the auction house's records, these works did not meet the standard and were not sold due to Lisa's criticism, and were eventually acquired by a mysterious customer named L.
servingTerm1: The subject seems extremely uncomfortable with the MBCC and claims that the environment is extremely tedious and lacks artistic vibe, which severely affects her motivation to fight. The frequent requests to the Bureau to "make necessary changes" are eventually given up due to the subject's failure to draw the design.
servingTerm2: The endless criticism of the Bureau improved significantly after the subject was allowed out to see exhibitions. The supervision staff reports that the subject did not show any suspicious behavior other than the over-the-top disguise for fear of being recognized.
servingTerm3: Only appreciates people good at art and feels suffocated when being in the same space with people who are not artistic. The subject's quirky personality made the subject have hardly any friends in the Bureau, but she is not bothered by it.
servingTerm4: The Chief has not shown any hint of anger or defense despite the subject's persistent, sharp criticism. Lisa has misunderstood this tolerance and recently began to encourage the Chief not to give up on life.
emotionCheck1:
[Lisa sits in front of the easel and sighs.]

**Lisa:** I drew the line crooked... again.

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** Do you need my help?
 * **Lisa:** There's no need. I appreciate it, but... I may as well take my time and do it myself.
 * **Lisa:** ğŸ˜¦

* **Prompt:** I'll give you a ruler.
 * **Lisa:** You...? Sigh... Forget it.
 * **Lisa:** ğŸ˜¥ğŸ˜¦ğŸ˜
emotionCheck2:
[Lisa takes out a painting with her left hand and places it on the table.]

**Lisa:** I've received a few paintings to enjoy.

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** I hope they have some paintings that brightens up your mood.
 * **Lisa:** Yeah. That would be perfect.
 * **Lisa:** ğŸ˜

* **Prompt:** I think they will all face your judgement one way or another.
 * **Lisa:** Of course. Unless they can replicate //Rebecca//.
 * **Lisa:** ğŸ˜¦
supervision1:
++* âš  Art Education

//Lisa sent you an urgent message!//

**System Notifications:** Lisa thinks the employees of the Bureau and Sinners lack art education and their aesthetics are terribly awful. She demands new courses that teach people how to appreciate the arts.

* **Prompt:** Call for a vote

**System Notifications:** Unfortunately, this idea only received two votes.
supervision2:
++* âš  Professional Attitude

//Lisa's Internet bill amount seems to be unusually high.//

**System Notifications:** Having harshly reprimanded the new artist at their exhibition, Lisa has drawn the attention of haters on the Internet, but she is not afraid of them. Standing her ground, she argued and quarreled with those haters for three days, eventually emerging victorious.

* **Prompt:** Show respect
supervision3:
++* âš  Rookie Art Exhibition

//Lisa sent you an urgent message!//

**System Notifications:** A new avant-garde artist who just rose to fame is holding an art exhibition in Eastside. Hearing the news, Lisa's excited and sent you an application to take leave and attend the exhibition to see if the artist lives up to their fame.

* **Prompt:** Approve
supervision4:
++* âš  The Drama of Oil Paintings

//Lisa seems a bit sad during the hypnotherapy session.//

**System Notifications:** During the hypnotherapy, Lisa recalled the time when she was painting back in college. This made her somewhat melancholy.

* **Prompt:** Comfort her
supervision5:
++* âš âš  Emerging Artist

//Lisa has made comments on Hecate's drawing.//

**System Notifications:** In the Darkroom, Lisa finds a painting Hecate has accidentally left there.

**Lisa:** Yeah...

**System Notifications:** Lisa seems to have something to say.

**Lisa:** Yeah...

**System Notifications:** You observe Lisa's face carefully.

**Lisa:** It's surprisingly... not bad.

**Lisa:** Although the artist clearly never had any professional training, they have their own insights into composition, colors, and imagery.

**Lisa:** Of course, the light and shadow and 3D structure are almost entirely overlooked in this painting. I'm not sure whether the artist was avoiding exposing their weakness or intentionally going for a specific style here.

**Lisa:** It has a Rustism and a post-Syndican feel to it, but clearly more sincere than those tawdry predecessors' works.

**Lisa:** Who's the artist?

* **Prompt:** Tell her

**Lisa:** [[[Hecate]]]? I indeed underestimated that kid.

**Lisa:** I have to write an article immediately to show those DisCity idiots what real art is.

**Chief:** That won't be necessary...
supervision6:
++* âš âš  New Try

//You find Lisa doodling something.//

**System Notifications:** You see Lisa holding a glass of wine and standing on the white sand in the Outdoor Activity Area, drawing something with the tips of her toes.

* **Prompt:** Approach and ask
 * **Chief:** Are you drawing something?
 * **System Notifications:** Lisa quickly steps on the drawing to erase it.
 * **Lisa:** Chief, why do you keep staring at my foot?
 * **Lisa:** That's quite impolite.
 * **Prompt:** Praise her
 * **Chief:** That drawing was quite nice.
 * **Lisa:** ...Thank you.

* **Prompt:** Keep observing
 * **System Notifications:** You find that Lisa has drawn a butterfly on the white sand. Though it looks a little clumsy, it has an ethereal beauty overall.
 * **Chief:** Your drawing looks very nice.
 * **System Notifications:** Sensing your approach, Lisa immediately erases the drawing on the ground with her foot.
 * **Lisa:** You think so? ...Thank you.
 * **Lisa:** But don't tell anyone about this.
 * **Chief:** I promise you.
supervision7:
++* âš âš  The Poison Is the Antidote

//Lisa has once again violated the Sinner regulations.//

**System Notifications:** Attention, Sinner Lisa is found to have violated Sinner rules repeatedly. Summon Sinner?

* **Prompt:** Approve

**Chief:** Lisa, you broke the rules again.

**Chief:** Let me see... Verbally attacking others on the internet up to three hundred times per hour?

**Chief:** Were you arguing with people over art again?

**Lisa:** Ha, this time was different. It was for something else.

**Lisa:** One of our little Sinners was being attacked on the internet. Our opponent even rallied a bunch of people for support.

**Lisa:** I couldn't just stand back and watch. I had to do something.

* **Prompt:** What happened in the end?

**Lisa:** Of course those bullies were no match for me. I destroyed all of them in less than an hour.

**Lisa:** Somehow it doesn't feel too satisfying.

**Chief:** ...I'll let it slide this time.
supervision8:
++* âš âš âš  OOTD

//Lisa asks you to pick out an outfit for her.//

**System Notifications:** Chief, you received a message from Sinner Lisa.

**Lisa:** Chief, are you free? Please come to my room if you can.

**System Notifications:** You come to Lisa's room.

**Lisa:** Long story short, I'd like you to help me pick out an outfit.

**Lisa:** For the top, left or right?

* **Prompt:** Left
* **Prompt:** Right

**Lisa:** And what about the pants? Which one looks better to you?

* **Prompt:** This one
* **Prompt:** That one

**Lisa:** Which pair of shoes do you think matches this style?

* **Prompt:** The white pair.
* **Prompt:** The black pair.

**Lisa:** Finally, the hat. Which one do you like better?

* **Prompt:** The one with feather.
* **Prompt:** The one without feather.

**System Notifications:** Lisa quickly changes into the clothes and looks at herself in the mirror.

**Lisa:** Very good, perfect.

* **Prompt:** Express confusion

**Lisa:** I'll explain to you now, Chief. I'm attending an art exhibition in Eastside today, but I'm worried I may get recognized due to my distinct style.

**Lisa:** Those idiots who know nothing about art, they'll be like, "Look, that venomous art critic woman is here again." "Kick her out before she starts insulting our paintings." You know, ******** like that.

**Lisa:** That's why I need you to help me create a disguise.

**Lisa:** Don't get it wrong though. I'm not saying you have bad taste.

**Lisa:** On the contrary, having observed you for a long time, I find that your understanding of beauty is very close to that of an average person.

**Lisa:** An outfit picked out by you is the perfect disguise.

**Lisa:** Bye, Chief, I've gotta go now.

**System Notifications:** I'm not sure if that's supposed to be a compliment or an insult...
baseVoicelines: [Obtain the Sinner] Arresting someone without evidence? What a good dog you are. I must say, this tasteless dump really suits you. [Raise to Phase 1] Ugh, don't annoy me with matters unrelated to art. [Raise to Phase 3] Who cares about powerful illusions? They can never replace real paintbrushes. [Level Start] You need to keep up. I'm not going to wait for you if you fall behind. [Win Battles] It is your honor to enjoy my feast for the senses. [Lose Battles] What a failure... [Ultimate Skill] How tacky! It must be destroyed! [Die in Battles] Is beauty always fleeting? [Greeting] How are you planning to waste your worthless life today? Actually, there's no need to answer. I'm not interested. It was just a polite greeting on my part. [Conversation 1] When I got into that car accident, half the Eastside art world secretly cheered. Those crass imbeciles didn't realize that as a painter, I simply stole some of their business, but as a critic, I could destroy them completely. [Conversation 2] What's the difference between those mindless paintings and that useless head on your shoulders? [Conversation 3] There is no authoritative standard for artistic expression. It's delusional to think that a few million DisCoins can define the value of a work. These Eastside upstarts are even shallower than you. [Special Conversation 1] Can I use your art forum account? I just wrote a review, but when I tried to post it, I discovered that my account had been banned. [Special Conversation 2] Don't give up just because I always say you're worthless! You have merits too! For example, you're... um... you're kind! [Special Conversation 3] I'm the critic who has made the biggest contribution to improving the art world. How dare they call me a shrew? Fine. I'll be the shrew as long as my words can awaken those incompetent fools. [Full Compliance] Upon closer inspection, your face is actually kind of good looking... what a pity, we met too late. No chance to paint a portrait of you and keep it now. [Idle] Sigh! Turned out crooked again... My hand can't even draw a straight line anymore... [Annoyed] You are hopelessly tacky! [Special Attention] Unless you've suddenly become enlightened enough to discuss the role of color in the emotional expression of the painting Rebecca, don't bother me. I have several critiques to write, and I have no time to waste with you. [Dispatch] Just don't take me anywhere tacky. [Dispatch Complete] Have you been waiting here all this time? Seems like the position of Chief is an idle job. [Level Up] Thank you... why, is it weird for me to say thank you?
attireVoicelines1:
[Attire Obtained]
Surprised to see me? It's nice and quiet here. I won't be disturbed. It's the perfect place for writing my critiques.

[Greeting]
If you're not put off by my comments of you from head to toe, there's an empty chair over there for you.

[Ordinary Contact 1]
The cocoon has turned into a butterfly after a winter on the branch. The once dead hyacinth is now budding again... So many miracles can happen in the greenhouse... What about in life?

[Ordinary Contact 2]
Ha, they call me jealous? Why should I be jealous of those speculators who know nothing other than marketing? All that publicity can't hide the fact that their works are trash.

[Idle] 
I can see a hint of creativity here... but the use of colors is too boring... It can be bolder...

[Annoyed]
The plants here are in need of some fertilizer... I see you're quite the material for it, huh?

[Special Attention] 
As the Chief, have you got nothing else to do besides staring at me? Go water the plants if you're so bored. The watering can is right there.

[Level Up}
Comment sent. Now, onto the next one...
nightmareTalent: All enemies' Movement Speed is lowered by 10%.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Fragile Item
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: When Lisa is on the battlefield, for every 10% reduction in enemies' moving speed, they take 2%/2.5%/3% additional damage, stacking up to 5 times.
exclusiveCrimebrand.flavourText:
"Don't give up on yourself just because of some little obstacles... you bastard."
"I didn't choose death even after what I went through..."

maniaIntensify.title: Tidal Surge
maniaIntensify.text: Energy Recovery Speed is increased by 15%.

crimebrandSets.name: Team Buff
crimebrandSets.note: Buff team's damage dealt whenever she ults.

crimebrandSets.name: Early team buff
crimebrandSets.note: Increase damage dealt by the team within the first 30 seconds of battle. Good for short battles like BFL.

crimebrandSets.name: Energy Set
crimebrandSets.note: Standard set to increase energy generation.

shackles.title: Light Color
shackles.description: After an [Inspiration Maze] disappears, a [Void Maze] will appear at the same location, halving the Movement Speed Reduction effect for 20 seconds.

shackles.title: Portray
shackles.description: [Butterfly] mark becomes stackable, up to 2 stacks.

shackles.title: Emotion Resonance
shackles.description: Ultimate Energy Consumption is reduced by 3 points.

skills.name: Consonance
skills.description: Lisa attacks with illusions, dealing (80% of Attack damage) Magic Damage each time.

skills.name: Inspiration Maze
skills.description: Lisa creates an [Inspiration Maze], lasting for 20 seconds in the target area. The Movement Speed of Enemies in the [Inspiration Maze] is reduced by 20%.

skills.name: Figure in Picture
skills.description: Enemies entering the [Inspiration Maze] becomes immobile for 1 second(s).

skills.name: Void Butterfly
skills.description: Enemies entering an [Inspiration Maze] each receives a [Butterfly] mark that reduces their Movement Speed by 10% for the rest of the battle.

compliance: Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term, Defense +3, Life +41
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 1, Defense +3, Health +41, Unlock Requirements: Dispatch Lisa 10 times
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 3, Unlock Requirements: Lisa's Shackle Sync Rate increased to 5
Unlock Voice: Paintings with Full Obedience and Unfinished Titles
